wikipedia_page.main: William Erwood Otway (23 April 1794, in Tewin, Hertfordshire – 1862, in Redbourn, Hertfordshire) was an English first-class cricketer associated with Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) who was active in the 1820s. He is recorded in two matches from 1824 to 1825, in both cases representing the Gentlemen against the Players, totalling 4 runs with a highest score of 3 and holding 2 catches. His brother was John Otway.

response: John Miles Otway (1 April 1793 in Tewin, Hertfordshire – 1 April 1872 in Welwyn, Hertfordshire) was an English first-class cricketer associated with Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) who was active in the 1820s. He is recorded in two matches from 1824 to 1825, in both cases representing the Gentlemen against the Players, totalling 25 runs with a highest score of 13 not out. His brother was William Otway.
